lines.text: Strange... You can read about a hundred atrocities, hear about a thousand, but you only have to see *one*!
Legally, we've been married ten years. Actually - just about a month. Very early, he told me I was one in a million. And I discovered he was telling the truth.
I'm curious. Ever since I met you, I've wondered what they have on you. The Allies, I mean. They've told me if I don't work for them, I lose my business.
Oh, I see. Yes, I have something to lose too. If I don't help them I lose my self-respect. Well, haven't *you* ever opposed anything for the simple reason that it's wrong? Morally wrong?
How does a person get to be so cold-blooded?
Watching German planes bomb London helps *enormously*!
In case one of us should get arrested and questioned, I think we ought to know a few intimate details about each other. Now, for your information, I have a scar, appendicitis, right here.
When other people hate you it's unfortunate. But when you hate yourself, it's unbearable.

My conscience has always been like a well trained dog. You could tell it to go sit in a corner and be quiet and it would. Since I've known you it hasn't been quite so obedient. It keeps shouting for me to do the very thing that your conscience won't permit.
